go_data.justification: The ALG10B protein is involved in the process of asparagine (N)-linked glycosylation.
The enzymatic step catalyzed by the ALG10B protein during N-linked glycosylation is the addition of the last glucose molecule to the glycan 'tree' inside the endoplasmic reticulum (ER).
The ALG10B protein catalyzes the addition of the last glucose molecule to the glycan 'tree' during N-linked glycosylation.
The ALG10B protein is involved in the process of asparagine (N)-linked glycosylation, which is a type of protein glycosylation.
A mutation in the Alg10b gene causes nonsyndromic hearing impairment in mice.
